alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henry and southeastern Franklin Counties including the City of Martinsville through 730 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Martinsville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail are possible with this storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Sydnorsville... Penhook... Snow Creek... Leatherwood... Villa Heights... and Chatmoss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
